metadata.title: CVE-2024-56557 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description: In the Linux kernel, the following vulnerability has been resolved:iio: adc: ad7923: Fix buffer overflow for tx_buf and ring_xferThe AD7923 was updated to support devices with 8 channels, but the sizeof tx_buf and ring_xfer was not increased accordingly, leading to apotential buffer overflow in ad7923_update_scan_mode().

criterions.comment: linux: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of ESM support').
linux-lts-xenial: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of ESM support').
linux-aws: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of ESM support').
linux-azure: while related to the CVE in some way, a decision has been made to ignore this issue (note: 'end of ESM support').
